svg.style: font-family:Lato, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Liberation Sans', sans-serif;font-feature-settings:"liga", "kern", "calt", "lnum";text-rendering:geometricPrecision;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;font-size:18px;background-color:#ffffff

a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Levelized cost of energy for renewables, World
The average cost per unit of energy generated across the lifetime of a new power plant. This data is expressed

in US dollars per
kilowatt-hour
. It is adjusted for inflation but does not account for differences in living costs

text.textPath: Fossil fuels – high end of the price range
Fossil fuels – high end of the price range
Fossil fuels – low end of the price range
Fossil fuels – low end of the price range

text.tspan: Note: Costs are expressed in constant 2024 US$ per kilowatt-hour.
